title: Strictly Come Dancing judges leave fans confused over ‘seriously odd’ scores
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Strictly Come Dancing fans were left seriously confused by the judges’ scores of the 2019 contestants last night.

Bruno Tonioli, Shirley Ballas, Motsi Mabuse and Craig Revel Horwood returned to the panel for the episode as the celebrities took to the infamous ballroom once again, with five of the stars receiving the number nine paddle.

Karim Zeroual and his partner Amy Dowden’s tango earned the highest score of the evening of 38, with Motsi and Bruno both awarding the couple 10 points.

Advertisement

Advertisement

They were closely followed by Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse, who got 36 for their rumba and Emma Barton and Anton Du Beke who were given 35 for their Viennese waltz.

Meanwhile, Safron Barker and AJ Pritchard were handed two nines for their couple’s choice, which was a contemporary routine to Because You Loved me by Celine Dion, taking their total to an impressive 33.

Following them were Mike Bushell and Katya Jones who danced the quickstep and were handed 32 points, including a nine from Motsi for their efforts.

The judges dished out high marks on Strictly last night (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Scoreboard Karim Zeroual and Amy Dowden: 38 Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse: 36 Emma Barton and Anton Du Beke: 35 Saffron Barker and AJ Pritchard: Couple’s Choice: 33 Mike Bushell and Katya Jones: 32 Michelle Visage and Giovanni Pernice: 31 Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe: 30 Emma Weymouth and Aljaž Škorjanec: 28 David James and Nadiya Bychkova: 28 Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell: 27 Chris Ramsey and Karen Hauer: 26 Will Bayley and Janette Manrara: 24 Alex Scott and Neil Jones: Tango 23

But the high scores from the expert panel didn’t go unnoticed by viewers at home, and they questioned whether some of the extraordinary marks were deserved.

Viewers were baffled by the judges’ markings

Sorry am I watching a different show? Where the hell are these marks coming from?! 🤔 #Strictly — Liam Twist (@LiamTwist) October 12, 2019

Some utterly crazy marks tonight. It’s a shame @The_JamesJordan hasn’t been tweet scoring as it’s all gone to pot this week. #strictly2019 #StrictlyComeDancing #strictly. — 🍻Gary🍻 (@ryan_da_lion) October 12, 2019

Some seriously odd marks from the judges this week. They started off ok and then went all emosh 😳. #Strictly — Joanne Powell (@JoannePowell14) October 12, 2019

Intoxicating high marks all round, what's up judges? #SCD #Strictly — Erik LFC Zoha (@ErikZoha) October 12, 2019

Craig’s marks are the only realisting marking this week in the show. All the others are marking OTT for some the dances which don’t deserve 9s I think some the judges are marking to weed out the ones the don’t want to see go through to the next show #strictly — TheWorld2Day (@ViewerViews) October 12, 2019

Strictly judges just picking up random paddles this week?! Some of these marks just don’t make sense!! #StrictlyComeDancing — Mimi Robinson (@life_art_mimi) October 12, 2019

What are the judges thinking tonight….they give Kelvin amazing comments then score him 9s, then also give Mike 9s 🤔 #Strictly — Karen Milne (@karenmilne63) October 12, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

Besides the controversial scores from the judges, last night’s episode of Strictly was full of action.

Katya was left in tears following her dance with Mike, with the 30-year-old professional dropping to the floor in tears after a particularly tough week of training.

After dancing the quickstep, Mike told Tess Daly that the dance felt good, explaining: ‘Because of the struggles, the flu, the cold this week

‘Thursday afternoon I never thought we’d get around like that.’

Elsewhere, Craig branded Kelvin filth as he critiqued the Emmerdale star’s rumba.

Speaking after his dance, Craig said: ‘Well you’re obviously in touch with yourself darling. We can certainly see that.

‘It was full of machismo which I loved. It oozed masculinity. It was filth.’

As the judges cackled, Motsi joked: ‘I don’t know, you know. I’m just like, hold on Kelvin that’s my sister, stop it!

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly Come Dancing judges leave fans confused over 'seriously odd' scores.
